channel.title: Where is k00dr when you need him

item.title: Where is k00dr when you need him
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Discount Waffles, post:2, topic:309889”]A quick run through gave me:

	public static String a(String in) {
		StackTraceElement[] trace = new java.lang.Exception().getStackTrace();
		String s2 = trace[1].getClassName() + trace[1].getMethodName();
		int v3 = s2.length() - 1;
		int v4 = s2.length() - 1;
		char[] v5 = new char[in.length()];
		int v6 = 85;
		for(int v7 = in.length() - 1; v7 >= 0; v7--) {
			v5[v7] = (char)(s2.charAt(v4) ^ (in.charAt(v7) ^ v6));
			v6 = v6 ^ (v7 ^ s2.charAt(v4)) & 63;
			v4--;
			if(v4 == -1)
				v4 = v3;
		}
		return new String(v5);
	}

Other people can confirm/deny results…[/quote]

ps that isn’t right

Read full topic
item.source: Where is k00dr when you need him

item.title: Where is k00dr when you need him
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

i think the makers of allatori are retarded… why do new exception().getstacktrace() when you can simply do thread.currentthread().getstacktrace()
ps welcome back discount waffles… ive been wondering who you are; i know that psb has been on your account

Read full topic

item.title: Where is k00dr when you need him
item.dc:creator: @Discount_Waffles Discount Waffles
item.description:
@Discount_Waffles wrote:

A quick run through gave me:

	public static String a(String in) {
		StackTraceElement[] trace = new java.lang.Exception().getStackTrace();
		String s2 = trace[1].getClassName() + trace[1].getMethodName();
		int v3 = s2.length() - 1;
		int v4 = s2.length() - 1;
		char[] v5 = new char[in.length()];
		int v6 = 85;
		for(int v7 = in.length() - 1; v7 >= 0; v7--) {
			v5[v7] = (char)(s2.charAt(v4) ^ (in.charAt(v7) ^ v6));
			v6 = v6 ^ (v7 ^ s2.charAt(v4)) & 63;
			v4--;
			if(v4 == -1)
				v4 = v3;
		}
		return new String(v5);
	}

Other people can confirm/deny results…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jython wrote:

public static java.lang.String a(java.lang.String);

   52:	astore_2
   53:	istore	4
   55:	invokevirtual	#10; //Method java/lang/String.length:()I
   58:	dup
   59:	newarray char
   61:	astore	5
   63:	bipush	85
   65:	istore	6
   67:	swap

   122:	iinc	7, -1
   125:	aload	5
   127:	iload	7
   129:	dup
   130:	ifge	74
   133:	pop2
   134:	new	#6; //class java/lang/String
   137:	aload	5
   139:	swap
   140:	dup_x1

   142:	invokespecial	#18; //Method java/lang/String."<init>":([C)V
   145:	areturn

   Start  Length  Slot  Name   Signature
   0      146      0    a       Ljava/lang/String;

i honestly cbf to reverse that… it plays with the stack too much anywayyy this is from allatori’s ‘maximum strong’ string encryption and it appears to use the caller information in the encryption. anyone wanna try there hand at it? anyone defeated it before?
